info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 10:31PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN HARRISON...NORTHERN JEFFERSON...SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...SOUTHERN BEAVER...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...NORTHWESTERN ALLEGHENY...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 PM EDT... At 1031 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lisbon to 9 miles northeast of Cadiz. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Moon Township, Weirton, Steubenville, East Liverpool, Aliquippa, Monaca, Wellsville, Economy, Ambridge, New Brighton, Toronto, Beaver, Calcutta, Baden, Wintersville, Rochester, Ohioville, Mingo Junction, Harmony Township, and Follansbee. This includes Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 34 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
